isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Electric Windshield Wipers - Intermittent Wipe & Wash

svcproc.title: Electric Windshield Wipers - Intermittent Wipe & Wash
svcproc.para: Wiper OperationRefer to ELECTRIC WINDSHIELD WIPER WITH INTERMITTENT WIPE AND WASH circuit diagram in CTS-5119S. With the key ON or OFF, battery power is always present at the common terminal (30) of Wiper Intermittent Relay (142). When the key is ON, the relay is energized and supplies power from the normally open terminal (87) for all wiper and washer operations. Power is applied to the wiper switch (431) at terminal 5.
Low Speed Wiper Operation-With the wiper switch in the position, power from terminal 5 is applied internally to terminal 2, then through circuit 82E to the low speed winding in the wiper motor.

High Speed Wiper Operation-With the wiper switch in the High position, power from terminal 5 is applied internally to terminal 6, then through circuit 82D to the high speed winding in the wiper motor. Note that power from 5 is not applied to terminals 3 and 4 in the high speed position, so power is not applied to the low speed winding.

Park Operation -Note that power is always present (with key ON) at P terminal of crank motor. When the wipers are operating, the circuit between wiper motor P and S is closed. In this position, power from P goes through S, through the normally closed contacts of the wiper relay (143) and back to the wiper switch at terminal 1. From terminal 1, the power goes through terminal 2 to the low speed winding and the motor continues to operate until the park switch rotates, closing the circuit between S and X, parking the wipers and turning off operation.
Intermittent Wiper And Washer OperationThe intermittent wiper and washer switches are part of switch assembly (432).

Intermittent Wiper Operation -With ignition key ON, depressing the intermittent switch (A) applies power from switch terminal C through circuit 82J to energize the wiper motor relay (shown de-energized). With the wiper motor relay energized, power from the energized wiper motor intermittent relay (142) passes through the wiper motor relay (143) and through circuit 82H to the wiper motor switch at terminal 1. With the wiper switch in the position (shown in diagram), the power passes through the switch (terminal 1 to 2) and is applied through circuit 82E to the low speed motor winding.
When the intermittent switch is released, wiper motor relay (143) de-energizes, turning off power to the wiper switch, and the wiper motor operates until it reaches the park position.

Windshield Washer Operation -Depressing the washer switch (E), which is part of switch (432), energizes the windshield washer pump and energizes the wiper motor relay (143) which causes the wipers to operate in the intermittent mode.
